headline: Fareed Zakaria GPS
subHeadline: Immigration Breakdown: A Fareed Zakaria Special. Aired 10-11a ET

utterances.speaker: DANA BASH, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: I mean, that was -- just to pick up on that FBI thing, this was a post by -- on his social media platform last night where he's calling for -- this is like the abolish the FBI, the FBI did all these horrible things that he says over and over again.

utterances.speaker: JENNINGS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: And now he wants the headquarters to be refurbished downtown.Does he think he's going to get the Trump Hotel back, which is right next door? I mean, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: JENNINGS
utterances.sentences: Well, I will tell you, members of Congress were hearing from the Republican grassroots about this. They had a vote on it not too long ago.And so there were members who were getting hammered by some of their base over this. And I heard from a few of them over the weekend that said, wow, I wish I had -- I wish I had known Trump's position just a few weeks ago when I was meeting with my constituents. Now that I have this in my back pocket, though, it'll be -- it'll be good to have. (LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: That was not on my bingo card for 2024, I have to say, definitely not.Guys, thank you. Thank you for everything this year. Happy, happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: KAREN FINNEY, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: JENNINGS
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Appreciate it. Appreciate everything. And, this week, my co-host, Jake Tapper, will sit down with House Speaker Mike Johnson. Be sure to watch that on "THE LEAD." It's this Wednesday at 4Thank you so much for spending your Sunday morning with us. Happy New Year to you. The news continues next. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) (MUSIC)

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Massive influx of migrants.

utterances.speaker: SARA SIDNER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: People who are scared, who are desperate.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The reality is, there's just too many people.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: My message is this, do not just show up at the border.(MUSIC)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We are the United States of America. None of us would have our children in that position. They are human beings.

utterances.speaker: RANDALL KENNEDY, HARVARD LAW SCHOOL
utterances.sentences: Who gets to be part of the American political family? Who can become an American?DONALD TRUMP, 45TH PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: Our country is full. TOM GJELTEN, AUTHOR, "A NATION OF NATIONS": How can anyone be anti- immigrant? We are all immigrants.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The glory of America is the melting pot.RONALD REAGAN, 40TH PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: The dreams that unfold here, it forebodes of what make America soar. GEORGE W. BUSH, 43RD PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: People are willing to risk everything for the dream of freedom. BARACK OBAMA, 44TH PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: We are and always will be a nation of immigrants. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: FAREED ZAKARIA, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: I'm Fareed Zakaria. Welcome to a special hour on immigration.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: ED LAVANDERA, CNN SENIOR NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: A major surge of border crossings -- ACOSTA

utterances.speaker: LAVANDERA
utterances.sentences: Reaching emergency levels.ZAKARIA (voice-over): It's no longer just a partisan talking point or a hyperbolic claim on FOX News.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The number of people arriving from other parts of the world have been staggering.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The country has been facing a surge of migration, the likes of which has never been seen.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Streams of people every day, every hour.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: A record 2.4 million migrants were apprehended at the border last fiscal year. That shattered the record set the previous year and nearly equaled the total population of Chicago.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And the clock is ticking.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Officials on the border are sounding the alarm.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Hundreds have been arriving every day to some border cities.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Now what?

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Sometimes tens of thousands of migrants in a single month.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All of our shelters are already at capacity.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: This is not even about politics. It's about humanity.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Families have been sleeping on the streets.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We have hundreds and hundreds and that's not the way we want to treat people.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Come on in, guys.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: These border towns are no strangers to big migrations. But they have never gone through anything like this.The numbers at the border went down in recent weeks after more restrictive measures were introduced, but the future is still very uncertain.

utterances.speaker: RACHEL SELF, IMMIGRATION ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: It's a perfect storm of a system that just is ultimately breaking.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Why is this happening now? It's a unique moment in the history of the hemisphere.The pandemic and climate change with its brutal storms, droughts and disease led to economic meltdowns, political unrest, and a perfect storm of migration.

utterances.speaker: DAVID FRUM, THE ATLANTIC
utterances.sentences: We have a planet of people on the move. More people moving to more places than ever before in the history of the world.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Cuban migration to the United States rose nearly 500 percent in a single year. Colombian migration rose over 1100 percent.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Major political upheaval continues to roil the nation.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Over seven million people have fled Venezuela to the U.S. and other countries. That is close to the exodus from war-torn Ukraine.

utterances.speaker: SELF
utterances.sentences: These are people who all had families, had lives, had jobs, and their country fell apart. Then they take the journey and the journey in itself is a life-or-death experience.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: One-year-old Brenda has no shoes.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: They've come to El Paso, a city with a proud history of welcoming immigrants overwhelmed by a global crisis.J. DAVID GOODMAN, THE NEW YORK TIMES: The leadership in El Paso, the mayor, was forced to declare a state of emergency there.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: They've come to small towns like Eagle Pass, Texas, which saw more migrants in one month than it had total residents.

utterances.speaker: GOODMAN
utterances.sentences: Even several hundred coming into a town can really have an impact on sort of the psyche of the people that were there.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The border turmoil has had a big impact on border politics.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The shocking twist came out of the border region.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Zapata County in Texas had not voted Republican for president since the 1920s. Mitt Romney lost there by 43 percentage points.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: For the first time in a hundred years --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Some blue went red.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But Donald Trump won in 2020.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: President Trump cared about the border.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: By five.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: County after county, voters have moved 40 points away from the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Republicans have made big gains all along the Texas border.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Flipped from blue to red.

utterances.speaker: GOODMAN
utterances.sentences: The fact that we're even talking about South Texas as a competitive area of the state of Texas is a real shift.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: It's a trend we've seen repeatedly all over the world, anger over immigration leads to hard-right populist power.Back in 2015, Europe witnessed its largest refugee crisis since the end of World War II, triggered by the brutal civil war in Syria. European nations took in millions. It was a courageous humanitarian action. But it sparked a major political backlash.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The British people have spoken and the answer is we're out.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The U.K. officially leaves the European Union.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Decided to leave the European Union, to go it alone.

utterances.speaker: NIGEL FARAGE, FORMER MEMBER OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT
utterances.sentences: We've got our country back.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: There was Brexit in Great Britain.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: She is anti-immigration and has been an admirer of Vladimir Putin's.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And Marine Le Pen with growing tallies in France.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Meloni started her political -- in real fascist part.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Just last year in Italy, a party descended from Benito Mussolini.

utterances.speaker: BEN WEDEMAN, CNN SENIOR INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Her platform is restrictions on migration.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: A turning point in Swedish politics.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There was formed by the Nazi movement.

utterances.speaker: ROSEMARIE CHURCH, CNN INTERNATIONAL ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Blamed liberal immigration policies for the country's problems.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: In Sweden, a party with Neo-Nazi roots --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Issues like crime, immigration front and center. ZAKARIA

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I just received a call from Secretary Clinton.

utterances.speaker: FRUM
utterances.sentences: In the United States we saw Donald Trump use the issue to get himself to the presidency.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Stop the steal.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: America showed up.

utterances.speaker: FRUM
utterances.sentences: And then began busting up all kinds of institutions that affected the lives of Americans.You never know until it's too late. If liberals won't defend the borders, fascists will.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Disturbingly America seems very open these days to an anti- immigrant message. More than half of Americans believe there is an invasion at the border including 40 percent of Democrats. And while three in four once believed that immigrants were important for America's identity, just over half now think that is true. And with 2024 fast approaching, two of the most politically savvy governors have honed in on this issue.GOV. GREG ABBOTT (R), TEXAS: We're dealing with smugglers, cartels. The Biden administration is doing nothing. It is unprecedented and it's dangerous.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: In Texas Governor Greg Abbott launched Operation Lone Star.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He's arrested thousands of migrants for criminal trespassing.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: As if to gird his state for a war. He's being a wall just like Trump did.

utterances.speaker: ABBOTT
utterances.sentences: We are building the border wall in the state of Texas.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Governor Greg Abbott has been sending migrants in bus loads.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Then there was the bussing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Where will these migrants be spending the night?

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Thousands were dropped off with little warning, even on the coldest Christmas Eve ever recorded in the nation's capital.GOV. RON DESANTIS (R), FLORIDA: If you look at what's going on at the southern border, it is a total disaster.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But the governor who outperformed everyone with his political theater --

utterances.speaker: DESANTIS
utterances.sentences: The cartels are just eating our lunch. ZAKARIA

utterances.speaker: DESANTIS
utterances.sentences: Aren't you glad to live in the free state of Florida?

utterances.speaker: LESTER HOLT, NBC NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: The nation's migrant crisis landing at an unfamiliar doorstep tonight.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: He hatched a secret plan to fly migrants to the liberal island of Martha's Vineyard. A former counterintelligence agent was used to target migrants in San Antonio with promises of housing and jobs. But when the migrants got off their plane, absolutely no one was expecting them. They had been duped.

utterances.speaker: SELF
utterances.sentences: There were just people wandering around on the island knocking on doors who didn't understand why they were there.UNIDENTIFIED MALE (through translation): To sum up the story, the trip was literally a trick.

utterances.speaker: SELF
utterances.sentences: What became very clear very quickly was that these people had been victims of a crime.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Without naming suspects, a Texas sheriff has recommended criminal charges alleging unlawful restraint. Governor DeSantis has denied any wrongdoing and has since orchestrated more flights of migrants to California.

utterances.speaker: DESANTIS
utterances.sentences: We are not a sanctuary state and, yes, we will help facilitate that transport for you to be able to go to greener pastures.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: He also passed one of the harshest laws punishing undocumented immigrants ever seen.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Laws that were created in the name of xenophobia.

utterances.speaker: DESANTIS
utterances.sentences: More racial profiling, frivolous stops.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Which could punish his state's economy to the tune of billions.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: These immigrant workers are the drivers of Florida's economy.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: If he becomes president, DeSantis promises mass deportations, ending birthright citizenship, and using deadly force against migrants at the border.How did we get here? America has long prided itself as the happy, vibrant melting pot, a nation that lives in harmony with its newcomers. But if we look back at our history honestly, more often than not, the story is filled with resentments, restrictions, and backlash. In the mid-1800s, fleeing a terrible famine at home, the Irish flocked to America. [10:15:02] They found a new home and jobs, but their arrival also sparked the rise of the xenophobic Know Nothing party. It called for restrictions on immigration and even violence, electing 100 congressmen, eight governors and a presidential candidate.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: The fact of the matter is, what is happening now has a long lineage.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: America accepted Chinese workers so that it could build out the west. That led to another violent backlash and the Chinese Exclusion Act which restricted a nation from America's shore.But the ugliest crusade against immigrants happened in the 1920s. A huge wave of immigrants was landing in America, the largest this country has ever seen. 100,000 people a month arriving at Ellis Island. Italians, Hungarians, Russians.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: You have the so-called good white Europeans, Great Britain, France, Scandinavian countries, those are the, you know, the real whites, the good whites. But then you have these Jews from Eastern Europe and you have the Italians from Italy, southern Europe.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: They were actually viewed as different races.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: In the 19th century, Hungarians are race, Czechoslovakians are race, Jews are race, Irish are race. They were whitish. There's a certain skepticism about them. They're viewed as lesser.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The new immigrants crowded into the tenements of New York's Lower East Side. Exotic food carts lined the sidewalks. Throngs of barefoot children played in the streets.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Many of the nationalities gather together in settlements of their own.JIA LYNN YANG, AUTHOR, "ONE MIGHTY AND IRRESISTIBLE TIDE: They worshiped differently. They have different religions, they dress differently. They're speaking Yiddish. They have Italian foods. These are all things that are completely new to America.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: All of it horrified America's wealthy elite, the blue bloods of Park Avenue and Fifth Avenue.

utterances.speaker: YANG
utterances.sentences: They begin to freak out. They freak out and say we can't allow all these hordes of new immigrants to come who are so different from us. They're going to change our country. These immigrants threaten everything they hold dear about America.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: So some of the nation's most prominent men got together and hatched a plan.THOMAS C. LEONARD, AUTHOR, "ILLIBERAL REFORMERS": These are men who saw themselves as the best and the brightest, for sure. And these are respected people. ZAKARIA: They put their money and prestige behind scientists who were studying so-called inferior races. A pseudoscience call eugenics.

utterances.speaker: GJELTEN
utterances.sentences: Whether you would be a good immigrant or not depended on your race and national origin.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The goal, use science to weed out those deemed unfit.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: They weren't beating around the bush. They weren't speaking in code. They said it very straightforwardly. We want to basically freeze the racial-slash-ethnic composition of the United States.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Eugenicists believed that the new immigrants were physically and mentally defective.

utterances.speaker: YANG
utterances.sentences: The more Jews you let in, the more Italians, they have all of these negative qualities that we don't want in the American population. They're more likely to commit crimes. They're more likely to be mentally insane or ill.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: If it sounds like Nazi Germany, Adolf Hitler embraced American eugenics.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Adolf Hitler had some real praise for the United States. Adolf Hitler says the United States is really on the money and we can learn from them.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Eugenicists decided it was time to go to Washington. They presented evidence to write a new immigration bill, the harshest the country had ever seen.

utterances.speaker: YANG
utterances.sentences: They have expert testimony. They have studies to show. And they basically say to Congress, it's not just you being prejudiced or racist, not wanting these immigrants. There's science to back this up.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: We don't want these people from other places coming. Come on.

utterances.speaker: LEONARD
utterances.sentences: They shut the door and reduced immigration to the United States by 97 percent.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The Immigration Act of 1924 made America a different country. It would get whiter and more monocultural.

utterances.speaker: MARTIN LUTHER KING JUNIOR, CIVIL RIGHTS ACTIVIST
utterances.sentences: Free at last. Free at last. Thank God Almighty, we are free at last.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Until a new revolution that changed everything.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The year was 1965. Freedom and racial equality were on the march -- from Selma to Montgomery.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We are standing before the forces of power in the state of Alabama saying we ain't going to let nobody turn us around.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And yet, America's immigrants were still effectively chosen based on the color of their skin. Asians, Africans and other groups were severely restricted.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Ellis Island will be their first taste of the Promised Land.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The race-based immigration system that began in the 1920s, which Adolf Hitler had admired, was still going strong.LYNDON B. JOHNSON, 36TH PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: Those who do come will come because of what they are and not because of the land from which they sprung.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But in the shadow of the Statue of Liberty, everything would change.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: With my signature this system is abolished.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: President Lyndon Johnson signed a sweeping new measure declaring that America would be color blind when choosing its immigrants.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: Now is the time to make real the promises of democracy.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The law was a little known chapter of the Civil Rights Movement, and it would change the face of America, setting it on a path to become a much more diverse country. This demographic revolution happened largely by accident thanks in part to a congressman who wanted to keep America white.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We are a prospering people. Wherever we live or earn our livelihood.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: By the 1960s, the authors of the racist immigration laws of the 1920s had gotten exactly what they wanted. America was overwhelmingly white.

utterances.speaker: YANG
utterances.sentences: They wrote laws to ensure that that would happen. And it worked.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Immigration had plummeted. The percentage of foreign-born Americans dropped by nearly two-thirds. As a "New York Times" headline had predicted, America's melting pot had effectively come to an end.But since the war against Nazi Germany, there had been a growing consensus that a race-based approach to immigration was wrong.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The Nazis devised their own quota system.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Because of the awfulness of Hitlerism, the awfulness of the Nazis, they say, this is terrible. We need to rethink this. We need to redo this.HARRY TRUMAN, 33RD PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: I shall ask for adequate and decent law for displaced persons.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: President Harry Truman despised the country's immigration laws.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All of them have been behind barbed wire for years.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: They discriminated against post-war refugees, shutting many of them out. Even holocaust survivors.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: President Truman signs a new bill.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: He signed a landmark law letting in more refugees.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Arriving in the USA is the first batch of displaced persons.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But he could not get rid of the race-based immigration system. President Eisenhower was also not a fan of the old laws.DWIGHT EISENHOWER, 34TH PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES: The calculated pressures of aggressive communism.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Because for him they damaged America's image as it fought the Cold War.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Soviet Russia parades its military strength.

utterances.speaker: GJELTEN
utterances.sentences: You had communist governments that were saying to their peoples, look, the United States is a racist country and we were very concerned about sort of losing a propaganda advantage.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We in America are immigrants.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: A new idea was born.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: A people welded from many nations and races.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: America, the land of immigrants.

utterances.speaker: YANG
utterances.sentences: We take it for granted that that's how we've always imagined ourselves. That's new at this time. JOHN F. KENNEDY, 35TH PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: One of the early champions of that new idea was John F. Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: He was part of the immigration story. The Kennedys, Irish immigrants.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: As a senator, he wrote a classic essay on the topic.J. KENNEDY: No distinction is made between the native born and the naturalized citizen.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And he called for an overhaul of the discriminatory immigration laws.J. KENNEDY: We want to go forward.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Pushing for fair immigration was not only right in Kennedy's view, it was good politics.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: In 14 weeks of campaigning, he attracts enormous crowds.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Since recent arrivals were gaining political clout. Kennedy's support for immigration --J. KENNEDY: Ask not what --

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: -- helped vault him to the presidency.J. KENNEDY: So help me God.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: In July of '63, he submitted an immigration bill to Congress.J. KENNEDY: All people can make equally good citizens.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Promising equal treatment of all peoples.Just a few weeks later, thousands marched on Washington.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Free at last, free at last. Thank God Almighty, we are free at last.

utterances.speaker: YANG
utterances.sentences: A time when there's protests saying we've got to have a country founded on equality of all people.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What do we want now?

utterances.speaker: YANG
utterances.sentences: We said that in our documents before but now it's time to really live it out.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But Kennedy's immigration bill stalled in Congress.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The president's car is now turning on to Elm's Street.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And then that November --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It appears as though something has happened in the motorcade group.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Tragedy struck.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The president of the United States is dead.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Vice President Johnson was suddenly thrust into power.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: I need your help. I cannot bear this burden alone.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: He urged Congress to honor the fallen president.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: No memorial oration or eulogy could more eloquently honor President Kennedy's memory than the earliest possible passage of the Civil Rights Bill for which he fought so long.I urge every American to join in this effort.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Congress responded.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All men are created equal --

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: -- passing the Civil Rights Act.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The most sweeping civil rights bill ever to be written into the law.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The Voting Rights Act.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: Today is a triumph for freedom.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Medicare and Medicaid.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: A nation that was built by the immigrants of all lands.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Immigration was next on the agenda.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: We should not be asking in what country were you born.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But the president faced a big obstacle. Congressman Michael Fein of Ohio.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL FEIN, THEN OHIO CONGRESSMAN
utterances.sentences: Our subcommittee held executive hearings this morning.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Fein a conservative Democrat who led the House's main immigration committee.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: Where's my immigration bill, God damn it? When are we going to get a bill out?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Our friend Fein is still sitting on it. ZAKARIA

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The voice of the people was heard in the land.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But thanks to Johnson's legendary political skills --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: An overwhelming mandate is headed to Lyndon Baines Johnson.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And the landslide election of 1964 --

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: Ours is a time of change.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: -- the president had the votes in Congress.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: Now under the monument which has welcomed so many to our shores.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: On October 3rd, 1965.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: The president signed the Immigration and Nationality Act. Every nation now had an equal shot at sending its best. The president and his allies did not expect the law to actually bring in a lot more immigrants.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: This bill that we will sign today is not a revolutionary bill.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Congressman Fein actually believed that America would stay white. He had negotiated a big concession in the bill to give family ties more weight.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: People pledge proud dedication to their chosen land.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: He assumed that that would benefit white Europeans since they already had relatives in America.

utterances.speaker: FEIN
utterances.sentences: Congratulations. Nice to have you.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But he would be proven very wrong. Immigrants arriving after 1965 were over 75 percent non-European. Coming from places like Asia and Latin America. They relied heavily on the family unification measures to bring in their clan. The very measures that the congressman had pushed for.Thanks to the 1965 act, America today is on its way to becoming a majority nonwhite country by 2045. (CHANTING)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Lock them all up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Shut your mouth. Go back.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: That colossal demographic shift --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If you don't like it, leave.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: -- met a wave of resentment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The president wondered aloud, "Why are we having all these people from shithole countries come here?"

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And migration under Trump plummeted by roughly two-thirds.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We take anybody. Come on in, anybody. Not anymore.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And those policies have led America into a new immigration crisis.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Seven million workers banished.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Desperate for people willing to go to work.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We've never had this many job openings ever in history.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: One hardly anyone is talking about.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Two job openings for every job seeker.

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: It's a big problem all over the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's actually been fueling inflation.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Which could take money out of your wallet.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The big question now, when will prices start dropping?

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Populist conservatives are right. America is facing an immigration crisis.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We are going to build a wall.

utterances.speaker: PROTESTERS
utterances.sentences: Build that wall! Build that wall! Build that wall!

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Our country is full.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But they're hung up on the wrong crisis. The real disaster isn't that too many immigrants have made it to the U.S.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You are now U.S. citizens. Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: It's that we aren't letting in nearly enough.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: The fertility rate in the United States fell to yet an all-time low.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: More and more American women are deciding not to have kids at all.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: America is in the middle of a baby bust.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT GUEST, DEPUTY EDITOR, THE ECONOMIST
utterances.sentences: The birthrate has fallen dramatically. It's below replacement level.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Not enough Americans are being born to replace those who have died.

utterances.speaker: LEONARD
utterances.sentences: Historically, the safety valve for the U.S. has been immigrants.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: But starting under President Trump, immigration to the U.S. plummeted. Cutting us off from the workers we desperately need.

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Growing fears of a recession.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And fanning the flames of economic decline.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: A massive labor shortage.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The highest inflation in 40 years.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The clock is ticking on Social Security.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: America has three options.

utterances.speaker: GUEST
utterances.sentences: You can either have more babies.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Which many experts say just won't happen.

utterances.speaker: GUEST
utterances.sentences: Or you can welcome more immigrants, or you can dwindle and fade into stagnation and irrelevance. I would favor the second option, welcoming more immigrants.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Instead, we've chosen the third, stagnation. Refusing to let in more foreign workers, according to one estimate, could cost the U.S. economy $9 trillion by 2030. On the other hand --

utterances.speaker: GUEST
utterances.sentences: If everybody in the world who wanted to move could move, by one estimate, the total income of humanity would double.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Immigrants flock in, one million a year.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Taking a page from America's old playbook.

utterances.speaker: GUEST
utterances.sentences: A number of countries noticed what it was that made America the richest, most powerful, most dynamic country in the world.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They have come with little but their clothes on their backs.

utterances.speaker: GUEST
utterances.sentences: By welcoming people from all sorts of places, and allowing them to become citizens.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Take Canada, for example. While America's population is 14 percent foreign born, Canada's population is 23 percent immigrant. And that number is about to rise even higher.Late last year, Canada announced a bold initiative. SEAN FRASER, CANADA'S MINISTER OF IMMIGRATION: Look, folks. It's simple to me. Canada needs more people.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: To bring in nearly 1.5 million foreigners in three years. Immigration isn't a threat to our northern neighbor. It's an opportunity.

utterances.speaker: JUSTIN TRUDEAU, CANADIAN PRIME MINISTER
utterances.sentences: We need people to arrive with their talents, with their hopes, with their dreams to build our communities, to build our future.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Study after study has shown that immigrants are world-class entrepreneurs. Over 40 percent of Fortune 500 countries were founded by immigrants or their children.

utterances.speaker: GJELTEN
utterances.sentences: Immigrants are the people who are most enterprising, the most courageous, the most creative. And these are precisely the people that can build an economy.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Immigrants in America are three times more likely to start a business than the native born by one count.

utterances.speaker: SELF
utterances.sentences: The American dream is alive and well in every single immigrant that I've ever worked with.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Canada expects a similar return on investment. And it carefully chooses who gets to be part of the Canadian dream.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: They came from many lands.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Since the 1960s, Canada has forged a unique world-renowned approach to immigration. UNIDENTIFIED MALE

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Favoring immigrants with the skills that their country needs.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Everyone has played his part.

utterances.speaker: GUEST
utterances.sentences: They decided to cherry-pick and they're making sure that they're getting the people who are going to really help them.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Canada's merit-based system has become the gold standard, copied by Australia, Singapore, the United Kingdom, and now Germany, mired in its own labor shortage.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Around two million workers are needed across multiple industries.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Even a butcher shortage which threatens the nation's bratwurst supply. Berlin last month created its own merit-based immigration system to fill crucial jobs.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Germany really is in urgent need of more foreign workers.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: While other nations opened their doors, America is falling behind.

utterances.speaker: SELF
utterances.sentences: Other countries are going to be better than us some day because we aren't allowing the best to come here anymore.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: Canada admitted over a quarter million skilled migrants and their families in 2021. The U.S. lets in only 85,000 highly skilled workers per year despite having eight times the population of Canada. The lucky few coming to America are just that, lucky and few. Skilled worker visas are so rare these days, they're awarded by a lottery.

utterances.speaker: FRUM
utterances.sentences: How can we drive home the point that this system is completely bonkers? What if we add a lottery on top of it? That just makes everyone understand this is capricious, arbitrary. The lottery is a symbol, but it's not a symbol of opportunity. It's a symbol of whimsicality.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Tech giants shed jobs at a rapid clip.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: What's more, even winning the immigration lottery --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Historic layoffs at Twitter, Meta, Lyft, and Amazon.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: -- is no guarantee that someone will stay in America.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: More than 200,000 tech jobs have been lost since the start of last year.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: When massive layoffs hit Silicon Valley in recent months, they likely included thousands of talented immigrants on temporary work visas. They were forced to find a new job in just 60 days or leave the country.

utterances.speaker: ZAKARIA
utterances.sentences: And now, some concluding thoughts on immigration. Ten years ago, the last serious effort to fix America's broken immigration system collapsed.In April 2013, a bipartisan group of senators, the so-called Gang of Eight, tried to push forward a package that included the usual sensible reforms that have been talked about for years. It included more border protections and sanctions against employing undocumented workers in the future, combined with a path to citizenship for currently undocumented workers. EDWARD KENNEDY (D), THEN MASSACHUSETTS SENATOR: This debate goes to the heart of who we are as Americans.
